revised_title: Description of the Everlasting Sacred Fire in Persia and its Properties
tldr: Dr. James Mounsey describes the Everlasting Fire in Persia, its properties, and how it is used for worship and practical purposes. The fire burns without consumption and can be extinguished by adding cold earth. It is believed to have burned for thousands of years and is worshiped by Indian priests and devotees. The fire is also used for boiling pots and producing lime, and it gives off no smoke or smell.
